com.segway.robot.sdk.vision.calibration

Interface RS2Distortion


  • public interface RS2Distortion
    Brief distortion model, defines how pixel coordinates should be mapped to sensor coordinates. Created by gaofeng on 2018/3/15.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  RS2Distortion.RS2DistortionTag 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BROWN_CONRADY
      Unmodified Brown-Conrady distortion model
      static int COUNT
      Number of enumeration values.
      static int F_THETA
      F-Theta fish-eye distortion model
      static int INVERSE_BROWN_CONRADY
      Equivalent to Brown-Conrady distortion, except undistorts image instead of distorting it
      static int MODIFIED_BROWN_CONRADY
      Equivalent to Brown-Conrady distortion, except that tangential distortion is applied to radially distorted points
      static int NONE
      Rectilinear images.

    • Field Detail

      • NONE

        static final int NONE
        Rectilinear images. No distortion compensation required.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MODIFIED_BROWN_CONRADY

        static final int MODIFIED_BROWN_CONRADY
        Equivalent to Brown-Conrady distortion, except that tangential distortion is applied to radially distorted points
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INVERSE_BROWN_CONRADY

        static final int INVERSE_BROWN_CONRADY
        Equivalent to Brown-Conrady distortion, except undistorts image instead of distorting it
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • F_THETA

        static final int F_THETA
        F-Theta fish-eye distortion model
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BROWN_CONRADY

        static final int BROWN_CONRADY
        Unmodified Brown-Conrady distortion model
        See Also:

      • COUNT

        static final int COUNT
        Number of enumeration values. Not a valid input: intended to be used in for-loops.
